issue.title: [C++] Allow in-memory array over 2^31 -1 elements but require splitting at IPC / RPC boundaries
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-493](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-493). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
To make Arrow a more flexible container for interacting with foreign data, it will be useful to be able to do zero-copy construction of arrays having a footprint of larger than 2 billion \* sizeof(type). When sending such data over the wire, we would need to break it into pieces of at most 2 billion
